intro: Berardia, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It comprises several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants are characterized by their showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble those of hibiscus. Berardia species typically have palmate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
